intro: Clematis spectabilis, commonly known as the rose of Sharon, is a deciduous vine native to eastern Asia. It features showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range from white to deep purple, blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant has compound leaves with three to five leaflets, and its stems are typically covered in fine, rusty-colored hairs. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Clematis spectabilis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
